intro: Gochnatia viscosissima, commonly known as the sticky gochnatia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically visited by various pollinators. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as woodlands and grasslands. Gochnatia viscosissima is known for its sticky secretions, which may serve as a defense mechanism against herbivores.
